page.title: 09Windermere Steamers,Bowness.
page.content:
{Windermere}is famous for its{'Great {White Birds'}- the steamers are named {TERN, TEAL, SWAN}and{SWIFT.}The term {'steamer'}is a slight{misnomer}however because all the ships are now{diesel powered although there is a move afoot to{reconvert}one of them back to{steam power by the new managers _ {The Windermere Iron Steamboat Company.
The{TERN}and{SWIFT}were built for {steam}power in{1891}and{1900 respectively. The{TEAL}and{SWAN}in {1936}and{1938. In{1985}the{SWIFT}is not in use but laid up at{Lakeside. The{livery}of the ships is pure{white with a thin{gold}line around them with a{dark green}bottom - hence the phrase {'The Great White Birds'.
